verses.kjv: Again the word of the LORD of hosts came to me, saying,
verses.web: The word of LORD of Armies came to me.
verses.ct: The word of the LORD of hosts came to me again.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; I was jealous for Zion with great jealousy, and I was jealous for her with great fury.
verses.web: LORD of Armies says: “I am jealous for Zion with great jealousy, and I am jealous for her with great wrath.”
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts says: "I burn with intense jealousy for Zion — a fierce, passionate jealousy."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; I am returned unto Zion, and will dwell in the midst of Jerusalem: and Jerusalem shall be called a city of truth; and the mountain of the LORD of hosts the holy mountain.
verses.web: LORD says: “I have returned to Zion, and will dwell in the middle of Jerusalem. Jerusalem shall be called ‘The City of Truth;’ and the mountain of LORD of Armies, ‘The Holy Mountain.’ ”
verses.ct: The LORD says: "I have returned to Zion and will live among the people of Jerusalem. Jerusalem will be known as 'The City of Truth,' and the mountain of the LORD of hosts will be called 'The Holy Mountain.'"

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; There shall yet old men and old women dwell in the streets of Jerusalem, and every man with his staff in his hand for very age.
verses.web: LORD of Armies says: “Old men and old women will again dwell in the streets of Jerusalem, every man with his staff in his hand for very age.
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts says: "Elderly men and women will once again sit in the streets of Jerusalem, each one leaning on a cane because of their old age."

verses.kjv: And the streets of the city shall be full of boys and girls playing in the streets thereof.
verses.web: The streets of the city will be full of boys and girls playing in its streets.”
verses.ct: "The city streets will be filled with boys and girls playing and laughing."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; If it be marvellous in the eyes of the remnant of this people in these days, should it also be marvellous in mine eyes? saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.web: LORD of Armies says: “If it is marvelous in the eyes of the remnant of this people in those days, should it also be marvelous in my eyes?” says LORD of Armies.
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts says: "This may seem impossible to the surviving remnant of my people in those days, but does that mean it's impossible for me?" declares the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; Behold, I will save my people from the east country, and from the west country;
verses.web: LORD of Armies says: “Behold, I will save my people from the east country, and from the west country;
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts says: "Watch — I will rescue my people from countries to the east and countries to the west."

verses.kjv: And I will bring them, and they shall dwell in the midst of Jerusalem: and they shall be my people, and I will be their God, in truth and in righteousness.
verses.web: and I will bring them, and they will dwell within Jerusalem; and they will be my people, and I will be their God, in truth and in righteousness.”
verses.ct: "I will bring them home, and they will live in Jerusalem. They will be my people, and I will be their God, faithful and righteous toward them."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; Let your hands be strong, ye that hear in these days these words by the mouth of the prophets, which were in the day that the foundation of the house of the LORD of hosts was laid, that the temple might be built.
verses.web: LORD of Armies says: “Let your hands be strong, you who hear in these days these words from the mouth of the prophets who were in the day that the foundation of the house of LORD of Armies was laid, even the temple, that it might be built.
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts says: "Be strong and take courage, all of you who are hearing these words today — the same words spoken by the prophets when the foundation of the house of the LORD of hosts was laid so the temple could be rebuilt."

verses.kjv: For before these days there was no hire for man, nor any hire for beast; neither was there any peace to him that went out or came in because of the affliction: for I set all men every one against his neighbour.
verses.web: For before those days there was no wages for man, nor any wages for an animal; neither was there any peace to him who went out or came in, because of the adversary. For I set all men everyone against his neighbor.
verses.ct: "Before those days, no one could find work — not people, not even animals for hire. No one was safe coming or going because of the constant danger. I had turned everyone against their neighbors."

verses.kjv: But now I will not be unto the residue of this people as in the former days, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.web: But now I will not be to the remnant of this people as in the former days,” says LORD of Armies.
verses.ct: "But now I will not treat the remnant of this people the way I did before," says the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: For the seed shall be prosperous; the vine shall give her fruit, and the ground shall give her increase, and the heavens shall give their dew; and I will cause the remnant of this people to possess all these things.
verses.web: “For the seed of peace and the vine will yield its fruit, and the ground will give its increase, and the heavens will give their dew; and I will cause the remnant of this people to inherit all these things.
verses.ct: "There will be peace for the planting season. The vines will produce their grapes, the ground will yield its crops, and the heavens will send down their dew. I will give all these blessings to the remnant of my people."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that as ye were a curse among the heathen, O house of Judah, and house of Israel; so will I save you, and ye shall be a blessing: fear not, but let your hands be strong.
verses.web: It shall come to pass that, as you were a curse among the nations, house of Judah and house of Israel, so I will save you, and you shall be a blessing. Don’t be afraid. Let your hands be strong.”
verses.ct: "People of Judah and Israel — just as your name became a curse word among the nations, so now I will save you, and your name will become a blessing. Don't be afraid. Be strong and take courage."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD of hosts; As I thought to punish you, when your fathers provoked me to wrath, saith the LORD of hosts, and I repented not:
verses.web: For LORD of Armies says: “As I thought to do evil to you, when your fathers provoked me to wrath,” says LORD of Armies, “and I didn’t repent;
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts says: "When your ancestors provoked me to anger, I decided to punish you," declares the LORD of hosts, "and I did not hold back."

verses.kjv: So again have I thought in these days to do well unto Jerusalem and to the house of Judah: fear ye not.
verses.web: so again I have thought in these days to do good to Jerusalem and to the house of Judah. Don’t be afraid.
verses.ct: "But now, in these days, I have decided to do good to Jerusalem and the people of Judah. So don't be afraid."

verses.kjv: These are the things that ye shall do; Speak ye every man the truth to his neighbour; execute the judgment of truth and peace in your gates:
verses.web: These are the things that you shall do: speak every man the truth with his neighbor. Execute the judgment of truth and peace in your gates,
verses.ct: "Here is what I require of you: Tell the truth to each other. Make honest and fair decisions that promote peace in your courts."

verses.kjv: And let none of you imagine evil in your hearts against his neighbour; and love no false oath: for all these are things that I hate, saith the LORD.
verses.web: and let none of you devise evil in your hearts against his neighbor, and love no false oath: for all these are things that I hate,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "Don't plot evil against your neighbors in your hearts, and don't love swearing false oaths. I hate all of these things," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD of hosts came unto me, saying,
verses.web: The word of LORD of Armies came to me.
verses.ct: The word of the LORD of hosts came to me again.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; The fast of the fourth month, and the fast of the fifth, and the fast of the seventh, and the fast of the tenth, shall be to the house of Judah joy and gladness, and cheerful feasts; therefore love the truth and peace.
verses.web: LORD of Armies says: “The fasts of the fourth, fifth, seventh, and tenth months shall be for the house of Judah joy and gladness, and cheerful feasts. Therefore love truth and peace.”
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts says: "The fasts held in the 4th, 5th, 7th, and 10th months will become joyful celebrations and happy festivals for the people of Judah. So love truth and peace."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; It shall yet come to pass, that there shall come people, and the inhabitants of many cities:
verses.web: LORD of Armies says: “Many peoples, and the inhabitants of many cities will yet come;
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts says: "The time is coming when people from many nations and cities will arrive."

verses.kjv: And the inhabitants of one city shall go to another, saying, Let us go speedily to pray before the LORD, and to seek the LORD of hosts: I will go also.
verses.web: and the inhabitants of one shall go to another, saying, ‘Let’s go speedily to entreat the favor of LORD, and to seek LORD of Armies. I will go also.’
verses.ct: "People from one city will go to another and say, 'Come on, let's go right away to seek the LORD's favor — let's go find the LORD of hosts. I'm going!' And the others will say, 'We'll come too!'"

verses.kjv: Yea, many people and strong nations shall come to seek the LORD of hosts in Jerusalem, and to pray before the LORD.
verses.web: Yes, many peoples and strong nations will come to seek LORD of Armies in Jerusalem, and to entreat the favor of LORD.”
verses.ct: "Many peoples and powerful nations will come to Jerusalem to seek the LORD of hosts and to pray before the LORD."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; In those days it shall come to pass, that ten men shall take hold out of all languages of the nations, even shall take hold of the skirt of him that is a Jew, saying, We will go with you: for we have heard that God is with you.
verses.web: LORD of Armies says: “In those days, ten men will take hold, out of all the languages of the nations, they will take hold of the skirt of him who is a Jew, saying, ‘We will go with you, for we have heard that God is with you.’ ”
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts says: "In those days, 10 men from nations speaking every kind of language will grab the robe of a single Jewish person and say, 'Let us go with you, because we've heard that God is with you.'"
